title: 5 reasons why you should back up your data to the cloud
description: There are many reasons it's wise to have your most important data files stored and accessible online. Here are our top five reasons.

title: The FBI has shut down one of the world's biggest cyber fraud platforms
description: The FBI, Europol, and multiple national police forces join to take down Genesis.Market.

title: ChatGPT and Google Bard studies show AI chatbots can’t be trusted
description: New studies on ChatGPT and Google Bard have shown that the AI chatbots will happily write conspiracy theories or worse.

title: This new ransomware could be the fastest encryptor ever seen
description: Researchers found Rorshach to be almost twice as fast as LockBit 3.0.

title: This PS5 patent will give your DualSense a cold - literally
description: A recently uncovered PS5 patent would add temperature control to DualSense pads. Yes, it's as bizarre as it sounds.

title: Data breaches and outages are more of a security risk than ever before
description: More than half of all businesses suffered a data breach in the last two years, report claims.

title: I hope Netflix's first pilot episode will help it kick its bad cancelation habit
description: Netflix is ordering a pilot episode of a series for the first time and maybe testing the waters will stop us getting burned by so many canceled series.

title: VPN downloads skyrocket following Italy ChatGPT ban
description: After authorities block OpenAI's ChatGPT over privacy concerns, Italians turn to the best VPNs to keep using the software.

title: Mobile gaming isn't the future of Mario, says his creator
description: Mario creator Shigeru Miyamoto reassures fans that mobile gaming isn't the future of the series.

title: Hackers can crack smart garage doors due to this embarrassing security flaw
description: Unless you want your garage door opened by hackers, unplug your Nexx devices now and submit support tickets.

title: The Last of Us PC port gets a fix from Nvidia – but its biggest problem remains
description: Nvidia has rushed out a fix for RTX 3000 graphics cards getting hit with random crashes.

title:
AWS is giving startups a big generative AI 
boost
description: Amazon is giving AI startups the chance to build their products using AWS cloud tools and resources.

title: Samsung Galaxy Z Flip 5 leaks suggest its biggest problem has been fixed
description: The Galaxy Z Flip 5's colors have leaked days after the first renders showing off its larger cover screen.

title: Call of Duty beefs up anti-cheat measures with brand-new high-level tech
description: Call of Duty’s Ricochet Anti-Cheat team has rolled out a new wave of measures with the help of some fascinating new technology.

title: Web.com unveils new appointment scheduling tool for small business websites
description: Appointments can be booked with or without a website, and availability can be set by team members with Web.com's new tool.

title: PayPal has a whole load of tools to help your SMB rake in more sales
description: SMBs can be more competitive by offering Apple Pay, card remembering, and automatic updating added to PayPal.

title: Starfield isn't coming to PlayStation, but the next best alternative is on sale
description: The PlayStation Spring Sale is in full swing, and it includes some mighty titles, including one very special space exploration RPG.

title: IRS-authorized tax service eFile was found sending out malware

title: WhatsApp may soon let you lock your chats away in a biometric vault
description: WhatsApp may let you lock your chats away in a fingerprint safe, boosting privacy.

title: Crusader Kings 3’s latest expansion gets a release date, and it’s delightfully soon
description: Crusader Kings 3’s latest expansion now has a confirmed release date. A world of medieval political intrigue awaits.

title: Your old work iPhone could soon be absolutely useless - and it's Apple's fault
description: Don’t expect to be repurposing an old work device, or cutting costs by investing in old iPhone models for the workplace.

title: Apple might block older iPhones from using iMessage, FaceTime, and other services
description: Apple might soon drop support for services like iMessage and FaceTime on older iPhones and other devices.

title: Microsoft’s new Xbox Series X controller is made from CDs and headlights
description: A special Earth Day Xbox controller is on the way and it's made of recycled parts for the world-conscious gamer.

title: HP LaserJet printers have a critical security bug - and there's nothing you can do for now
description: With a patch up to 90 days away, HP advises customers to downgrade printer firmware or risk information disclosure.

title: Miss Amazon Smile? This Chrome extension makes online shopping feel good again
description: Amazon might have ditched its Smile program, but Shop for a Cause lets you save, spend and share

title: iOS 17 leak reveals the iPhones (and iPads) being left behind
description: A new leak has seemingly revealed the iPhones and iPads that won’t be supported by iOS 17 and iPadOS 17.

title: A benchmark test uncovered some critical vulnerabilities in thousands of QNAP devices
description: Two zero-days discovered affecting some 80,000 QNAP NAS devices.

title: Mysterious Windows 11 bug hits AMD’s best processor
description: Does your Ryzen 5800X3D CPU refuse to work with Windows 11? You’re not alone…

title: OLED MacBook Pros won’t arrive until 2026, so I'm pinning my hopes on an OLED MacBook Air
description: Despite a new manufacturing partnership with Samsung, it looks like Apple won't have an OLED MacBook Pro for a while.

title: Hybrid working is still causing annoying issues for workers everywhere

title: Kobo's newest Elipsa 2E ereader is ready to take down the Kindle Scribe
description: Kobo has announced a new 10.3-inch ereader as a competitor to the Kindle Scribe, and has extended its ebook subscription service to more markets.

title: Waze taps into the cosmos to make skipping traffic even more fun
description: Alongside the Zodiac motifs, Waze's 2021 Halo Infinite theme returns and while also adding punny design packs.
